abstract: The Apple Pay button types you can display to initiate Apple Pay transactions.
overview:
## Overview

The button type you use for payments made with Apple Pay can affect the purchasing experience. Choose a button type that best fits with the terminology and flow of your purchase or payment experience. For design guidance, see [https://developer.apple.com/design/human-interface-guidelines/apple-pay/overview/buttons-and-marks/].

Before using a specific button type, check that it’s available to the iOS version that your app is running on. Create buttons using the [doc://com.apple.passkit/documentation/PassKit/PKPaymentButton/buttonWithType:style:] method.

# PKPaymentButtonType

**Enumeration**

The Apple Pay button types you can display to initiate Apple Pay transactions.

## Declaration

```swift
enum PKPaymentButtonType
```

## Overview

The button type you use for payments made with Apple Pay can affect the purchasing experience. Choose a button type that best fits with the terminology and flow of your purchase or payment experience. For design guidance, see [https://developer.apple.com/design/human-interface-guidelines/apple-pay/overview/buttons-and-marks/].

Before using a specific button type, check that it’s available to the iOS version that your app is running on. Create buttons using the [doc://com.apple.passkit/documentation/PassKit/PKPaymentButton/buttonWithType:style:] method.

## Payment button types

- **PKPaymentButtonType.plain**: An Apple Pay button with the Apple Pay logo only, useful when an additional call to action isn’t needed.
- **PKPaymentButtonType.buy**: An Apple Pay button useful for product purchases.
- **PKPaymentButtonType.addMoney**: An Apple Pay button useful for adding money to a card, account, or payment system.
- **PKPaymentButtonType.book**: An Apple Pay button useful for booking trips, flights, or other experiences.
- **PKPaymentButtonType.checkout**: An Apple Pay button useful for purchase experiences that include other payment buttons that start with “Check out”.
- **PKPaymentButtonType.continue**: An Apple Pay button useful for general purchases.
- **PKPaymentButtonType.contribute**: An Apple Pay button useful to help people contribute money to projects, causes, organizations, and other entities.
- **PKPaymentButtonType.donate**: An Apple Pay button used by approved nonprofit organization that lets people make donations.
- **PKPaymentButtonType.inStore**: An Apple Pay button useful for paying bills or invoices.
- **PKPaymentButtonType.order**: An Apple Pay button useful for placing orders for such as like meals or flowers.
- **PKPaymentButtonType.reload**: An Apple Pay button useful for adding money to a card, account, or payment system.
- **PKPaymentButtonType.rent**: An Apple Pay button useful for renting items such as cars or scooters.
- **PKPaymentButtonType.setUp**: An Apple Pay button useful for prompting the user to set up a card.
- **PKPaymentButtonType.subscribe**: An Apple Pay button useful for purchasing a subscription such as a gym membership or meal-kit delivery service.
- **PKPaymentButtonType.support**: An Apple Pay button useful supporting people give money to projects, causes, organizations, and other entities.
- **PKPaymentButtonType.tip**: An Apple Pay button useful useful for letting people tip for goods or services.
- **PKPaymentButtonType.topUp**: An Apple Pay button useful for adding money to a card, account, or payment system.

## Initializers

- **init(rawValue:)**

## Configuring the appearance

- **PKPaymentButtonStyle**: A type that indicates the available appearances for an Apple Pay button.
- **cornerRadius**: The radius, in points, for the rounded corners on the button.

## Conforms To

- BitwiseCopyable
- Equatable
- Hashable
- RawRepresentable
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
